data.text: Living or able to live both on land and in the water.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: In zoöl and botany, living close to water, and sometimes entering it, but not necessarily existing by it: as, the semiaquatic spiders, which run over the surface of water, or dive and conceal themselves beneath it; semiaquatic plants, which grow between tides, or in pools that periodically become dry, etc.

data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: partially aquatic; living or growing partly on land and partly in water
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.

data.text: having an aquatic early or larval form and a terrestrial adult form
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
